resources.string: In order to proceed with your device upgrade you must decrypt previously encrypted apps. Click continue to unlock your credential store and decrypt your apps. Once complete you will have the option to enable full device encryption.
Encrypting your SD card will erase any data. Non-encrypted cards will be mounted read-only. Press OK to enable encryption or choose Skip to mount as read-only.
Enable network only when screen is turned on to extend battery life

"Smart network helps to conserve battery life.
It disables mobile data and Wi-Fi when the screen is turned off, so that the device consumes less battery.
However, you may receive cumulative push data when you turn on the screen"
Huge font size will only be applied in specific applications. Large font size will be applied in all other applications
Screen will be locked after %s of inactivity
Screen will be locked instantly with power key or screen timeout
Screen will be turned off when screen is locked
Screen will be turned off when screen is locked. Secured lock time is currently set to %s
Password should have more than 4 digits

An application on your device is requesting permission to turn on Bluetooth and make your device visible to other devices. Allow?

string.name: sdcard_settings_factory_reset_warning
string.li: The key for decrypting files on the SD card. (You cannot use files on the SD card after a factory data reset)

resources.string: Manage Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Flight mode, mobile networks, and VPNs
Connect to data services when roaming

You have lost data connectivity because you left your home network with data roaming turned off

Password required to decrypt device each time you turn it on

"You can encrypt accounts, settings, downloaded applications and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your device, a password will be required to decrypt it each time you power it on
Encryption takes an hour or more. Start with a charged battery and keep device plugged in until encryption is completed. Interrupting may lose some or all data"
Set screen unlock password before you can start encryption

Encrypt device? Operation irreversible and if you interrupt it, you will lose data. Encryption could take an hour or more, during which device will restart several times and you cannot use your device
Wait while device is encrypted. ^1% complete
Unable to complete encryption due to interruption. Perform factory data reset (erasing all your data) before use. After resetting, try encrypting device again
Unable to complete decryption due to interruption. Perform factory data reset (erasing all your data) before use.
Create backup unlock PIN or pattern
Change or disable pattern, PIN, or password

Password must contain at least %d characters
PIN must contain at least %d numbers
Password must contain no more than %d characters
PIN must contain no more than %d digits
Password must contain at least one letter
Password must contain at least one number
Password must contain at least one symbol
Password must meet requirements. Contact IT administrator

Device is not connected to Sim Access Server
Connected to device for Internet access
Local Internet connection shared with device
Allow data exchange when device touches another device
When NFC is on, you can send or receive data when your device touches other NFC-capable devices or NFC tags
You can read and write tags and transfer data between devices
Ready to transmit app content via NFC
Android Beam not available. NFC turned off

When this feature is on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, YouTube videos, contacts, and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what is beamed

When this feature is on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, contacts, and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what is beamed
Allow apps on other devices to discover apps on this device
Ready to send file via NFC and Wi-Fi direct
S Beam not available. NFC turned off

When this feature is turned on, you can beam files to other NFC and Wi-Fi Direct devices by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam image/video files from the Gallery, music files from the Music Player, notes from S Note, and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what gets beamed

When this feature is turned on, you can beam files to other NFC and Wi-Fi Direct devices by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam image/video files from the Gallery, music files from the Music Player, and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what gets beamed
S Beam not available. Android Beam turned off
NFC and Android Beam are turned on

1. Activate Wi-Fi on the device
2. Find %1$s in Wi-Fi network list and connect to it
3. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi Hotspot

1. Activate Wi-Fi on the device
2. Find %1$s in Wi-Fi network list
3. Connect to %2$s by entering %3$s as the password
4. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi hotspot

"You can use your device as an internet AP (Access point) using portable Wi-Fi hotspot. This allows other devices (maximum 10) to connect to it via Wi-Fi. The connected devices will have access to the internet via your data network
Note: it will cause your mobile data and consumes more battery"

1. Turn on Wi-Fi on the device
2. Find %2$s in Wi-Fi network list
3. Connect to %2$s
4. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi Hotspot

1. Turn on Wi-Fi on the device
2. Find %2$s in Wi-Fi network list
3. Connect to %2$s by entering %3$s as the password
4. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi hotspot

1. Turn on Wi-Fi on the device
2. Manually add %2$s as a Wi-Fi network
3. Connect to %2$s
4. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi Hotspot

1. Turn on Wi-Fi on the device
2. Manually add %2$s as a Wi-Fi network
3. Connect to %2$s by entering %3$s as the password
4. Enjoy Internet with portable Wi-Fi hotspot

"Turn your phone into a portable Wi-Fi hotspot so you can share your mobile data connection with other devices.
To use your phones hotspot capability, you must have the Smartphone Mobile HotSpot service added to your rate plan.
You can create an allowed device list and set the connection mode for allowed devices."

"You can use your device as an internet AP (Access point) using portable Wi-Fi hotspot. This allows other devices (maximum %1$s) to connect to it via Wi-Fi. The connected devices will have access to the internet via your data network"
Note: This will enable mobile data and consume more battery
Mobile Hotspot consumes more battery. Connect the device to an outlet to extend battery life
The maximum number of allowed device list is 10
You can create an allowed device list and set the connection mode for allowed devices
Warning: Selecting Open(no security) may make your device mobile hotspot accessible by unauthorized users. Consider using WPA2 Personal security.

Note that the charge for data transmitted and received while using this service internationally can be as high as $20.48 per MB. Please check your calling plan for the applicable charges in the location where you plan to use the service.
Please enter a valid IPv4 address
Please enter the lease time in minutes.(Minimun is 2 minutes)
Please enter the maximum number of users that can use DHCP to get their IP address.
Changing max clients will disconnect linked devices. Continue?
IP has to be in the same range as the Local IP.
The Sprint Hotspot has to be restarted to take effect this new configuration.

When tethering is enabled, all packet transmission is regarded as communications made by connecting to a PC or other external device. In this case, Packet communication charges may apply even when external devices are not connected. To avoid additional costs, disabling tethering is strongly recommended when finished.
Portable Wi-Fi hotspot consumes much battery power and increases your data usage. Continue?
Your phone will be visible to other devices
Set up and manage Mobile Wi-Fi HotSpot
Your HotSpot is no visible now

If you switch the Broadcast Network name (SSID) option off, your phone will not be visible to other devices and will not appear in the list of available Wi-Fi networks. Other devices van still connect toto you HotSpot by entering its network name Manually.
Do not show me this message again

"Introduction Portable Wi-Fi hotspot
""Portable Wi-Fi hotspot allows your Android-powered device to be used as a mobile hotspot for up to ten devices using your phone's data connection. If using this service, you should secure the connection to deny unauthorized access. This service consumes battery power and increases your data usage. This service requires a subscription to the applicable modem plan. Please ensure you have subscribed to the appropriate data plan prior to use. Call 888-944-9400 if you need assistance. Use of service constitutes acceptance of the" Smartphone Modem Terms.

Enable Wi-Fi Direct to set up peer-to-peer connectivity

Wi-Fi Direct enables Wi-Fi devices to connect directly, making printing, file sharing, synchronising, and screen sharing much simpler and more convenient. Connecting to devices that support Wi-Fi Direct makes it possible to share your content, synchronise your data, socialise with friends, play games, audio, videos, and more, using various applications

Allows Google to use your location data for improved search results and other services
Enhance positioning and save power using sensors

Sensors enhance pedestrian positioning and save battery power. When indoors or underground, sensors work best if handset is aligned with direction of movement. Distorted magnetic fields will affect performance

GPS location and use of your location data are controlled by the applications you use

How to draw an unlock pattern

Protect device from unauthorised use by creating a personal screen unlock pattern. Use your finger to connect the dots in any order on the next screen. You must connect at least four dots. Ready? Tap Next

"Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your device.
Some accounts, such as Google accounts, may also automatically copy any changes you make on the device to the web.
To select what information to sync for each account, go to Settings > Accounts"
"This will conserve data and battery usage, but you'll need to sync each account manually to collect recent information. And you won't receive notifications when updates occur"

%1$s data connection will be disabled when specified limit is reached. Data usage is measured by your device, and your service provider may account for usage differently, so consider using a conservative limit

"Your mobile data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.
Since data usage is measured by your phone, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit"
Restricting background data will stop some apps and services from working unless device is connected to a Wi-Fi network
%2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your device. Your service provider may account for usage differently
Select the Wi-Fi networks which are mobile hotspots. You can restrict background apps from using these networks. You can also set apps to warn you before using these networks for large downloads
To select mobile hotspots, turn Wi-Fi on
A certificate is missing. Edit the profile

After enabling explore by touch, you can touch the screen to learn about what you are touching. For example, the current screen contains app icons. Find one of them by touching the screen and sliding your finger around
Good. Keep swiping your finger around the screen to find at least one more icon
To use something that you touch, tap it. Swipe your finger until you find the %s icon then tap the icon once to use it
Your finger is touching the %s icon. Tap once to activate icon
Your finger moved over the %s icon, and then moved away. Slowly swipe your finger around the screen until you find the %s icon again
Good. To move to the next lesson, find and tap the %s button, near the bottom-right corner of the screen
To scroll through a list, swipe two fingers up or down the screen. For example, the current screen contains a list of app names. Try to identify a few items in the list by swiping one finger around
Good. Keep swiping your finger around to find at least one more item
Now place two fingers on an item in the list and swipe both fingers up. If you reach the top of the screen, lift your fingers, place them lower on the list, and continue swiping up
Good. Keep swiping your fingers up to scroll further
End of tutorial. To close, find and tap the %s button

Preparing. This could take over 10 minutes...
Wait while device is decrypted. ^1% complete

Decrypt device? Operation irreversible and if you interrupt it, you will lose data. Decryption could take an hour or more, during which device will restart several times and you cannot use your device

You can decrypt accounts, settings, downloaded applications and their data, media, and other files. Decryption could take an hour or more. Start with a charged battery and keep device plugged in until decryption is completed. Interrupting decryption process may lose some or all data
Try again. If you enter an incorrect password ^1 more times, all data in device storage will be erased
Set an unlock password of at least 6 characters, containing at least 1 number
If you select this option, only used memory space will be encrypted
Password required to decrypt SD card each time it is connected
Encrypt new files on SD card
New files on SD card will be encrypted
Encrypt all files on SD card

Multimedia files on SD card will not be encrypted

Wait until SD card encryption is completed
Wait until SD card decryption is completed

To use your SD card, it must be encrypted. Tap Continue to encrypt your SD card
Name must contain no more than 32 characters.

This option limits the maximum CPU performance and helps to conserve battery life. It will not affect normal usage, like browsing and video playback, if you do not use resource-intensive apps and games
This option reduces the screen frame rate and lowers the brightness. It helps to extend battery life when the screen is turned on

Press the pen button, and tap and hold on the screen. You can capture the screen, draw on it, and share it from anywhere with the pen
With the two gestures below, you can go back to the previous screen or open menus without putting the pen down
To go back, drag the pen from right to left while pressing the pen button. This pen gesture works like the back key
To open menus, drag the pen from the bottom to top while pressing the pen button. This pen gesture works like the menu key
To go to the home screen, drag the pen from the top to bottom while pressing the pen button. This pen gesture works like the home key
Disabling pen detection when the pen is attached can extend battery life
Open Popup Note when the pen is detached
Air view and Talkback cannot both be enabled. Talkback will be disabled
Hold the pen nib near the screen to see more information
The air view pointer is shown on the screen
A preview of information, the full text, or zoomed-in image is shown on the screen
Scroll down or up lists by holding the pen over the edge of the screen
Pen ripple effect for Lock and Home screen
When pen is held over the screen with the pen button pressed, the available pen gestures will appear around the hover pointer
Create pen gestures to open selected applications or perform tasks
Sound alert and show pop-up when you walk with the device without attaching the pen
The number of steps taken before the alert occurs may differ depending on the person. Some movements similar to walking may cause the alert to occur as well
When the pen nib is held near the screen for a while, the air view features will appear
Hover the pen over the list below
Hover the pen over an item for a moment. You will be able to experience all the features described below
When the pen nib is near the screen, the air view pointer is shown on the screen
When there is air view information, the pointer will look like the image below
When the pen nib hovers near a specific object for a while, an info pop-up will be shown
When the pen nib hovers near the image for a while, it will become the zoom control
When the pen nib hovers near an icon for a while, a label pop-up will be shown
When the pen nib hovers near the edge of the screen for a while, the list will scroll
Perform the pen gestures described below while pressing the pen button
To go back to the previous screen, draw a less-than arrow (〈) while pressing the pen button
To open a menu, draw a caret symbol (^) while pressing the pen button
To open Popup Note, double tap the screen while pressing the pen button
To open the Quick Command, drag the pen from the bottom to the top of the screen while pressing the pen button
To capture the screen, tap and hold on the screen while pressing the pen button

To select an area of an image to copy from the screen, draw a closed shape around the area you want while pressing the pen button. The selected area will be copied to the clipboard and saved in Gallery
To select text, tap and drag the pen across the text you want to select while pressing the pen button
Quick Command allows you to use the pen to write command shortcuts to open applications, perform predefined tasks, create shortcuts, and search for any keywords
To open the Quick Command, drag the pen from the bottom to the top of the screen while pressing the pen button
You can write command shortcuts in the Quick Command window to perform tasks. Add keywords to perform more specific tasks
You can write a command gesture on the pad to open the application needed for the predefined task

"You can write a command more specific by adding a keyword after the command shortcut. For example, you can write the command gesture to open Email followed by a contact's name to open an email addressed to that contact"
If the application, currently running when the Quick Command pad is opened, supports the search function, you can write any keyword on the pad to search for it in that application

"If the keyword is already assigned as a command gesture, you can choose what to do: 1) Search for the keyword in the application that is currently running, by tapping the app, or 2) Perform the predefined task by tapping on the pad"
If the keyword is already assigned as a command gesture, then the predefined task is prioritised and the keyword will not be searched for
Help text automatically guides you through predefined tasks. It provides step-by-step guidance and feedback as you write commands

The one-handed operation settings help you to use keypads easily with only one hand. If you select one-handed operation, the position of the dialling keypad, in-call buttons, Samsung keyboard, and Calculator can be adjusted by tapping the arrows on either side of the screen. If you tap the right arrow, the keypad slides right, and if you tap the left arrow, the keypad slides left. The unlock pattern cannot be moved left or right, but can be resized

"This app is provided by a 3rd party. Its use of your information is not covered under your carrier's Privacy Policy. You should review the app provider's policies to determine how this app uses your personal data. For more info click below"

If you use a 3rd party app, it may directly collect your personal information or require Sprint to disclose your personal information, including location information (where applicable), to the app provider or some other 3rd party

"Which Privacy Policy Applies? Sprint's Privacy Policy and Terms of Use do not apply to apps on your handset that are solely provided by 3rd parties. The 3rd party's policies apply to your use of this app"

"Where Can I Find More Information About the 3rd Party's Policies? Check the app's terms of use and/or the app provider's policies for more information about how the app will collect, access, use and disclose your information. Privacy Policies, Terms of Use and other consumer notices MAY BE available on the provider's website. Be sure you are comfortable with the policies before you use an app"
"Where Can I Find Sprint's Privacy Policy? Separately, if you have questions about Sprint's Privacy Policy, please visit Sprint.com and click on the “Privacy Policy” link"

If you use a 3rd party app, it may directly collect your personal information or require your carrier to disclose your personal information, including location information (where applicable), to the app provider or some other 3rd party

"Which Privacy Policy Applies? Your carrier's Privacy Policy and Terms of Use do not apply to apps on your handset that are solely provided by 3rd parties. The 3rd party's policies apply to your use of this app"
"Where Can I Find my carrier's Privacy Policy? Separately, if you have questions about your carrier's Privacy Policy, please visit your carrier's homepage and click on the “Privacy Policy” link"

If you use a 3rd party app, it may directly collect your personal information or require Boost Mobile to disclose your personal information, including location information (where applicable), to the app provider or some other 3rd party

"Which Privacy Policy Applies? Boost Mobile's Privacy Policy and Terms of Use do not apply to apps on your handset that are solely provided by 3rd parties. The 3rd party's policies apply to your use of this app"
"Where Can I Find Boost Mobile's Privacy Policy? Separately, if you have questions about Boost Mobile's Privacy Policy, please visit Boost Mobile.com and click on the “Privacy Policy” link"

If you use a 3rd party app, it may directly collect your personal information or require Virgin Mobile to disclose your personal information, including location information (where applicable), to the app provider or some other 3rd party
"Virgin Mobile's Privacy Policy and Terms of Use do not apply to apps on your handset that are solely provided by 3rd parties. The 3rd partys policies apply to your use of this app"

"Check the app's terms of use and/or the app provider's policies for more information about how the app will collect, access, use and disclose your information. Privacy Policies, Terms of Use and other consumer notices MAY BE available on the provider's website. Be sure you are comfortable with the policies before you use an app"
"Separately, if you have questions about Virgin Mobile's Privacy Policy, please visit virginmobileusa.com and click on the “Privacy Policy” link"

THIS HANDSET CAN DETECT YOUR LOCATION

"If you turn location \"ON\" and activate a third party location based service on this handset, you consent to U.S. Cellular's use of and disclosure to such third party of this handset's location. Turning location \"ON\" will allow U.S. Cellular to track the location of this handset and share such information with third party providers of location-based services. Once this handset's location information is transferred from U.S. Cellular to the third-party location-based service provider, that third party's privacy policy will govern subsequent uses of your location information. You should carefully review the terms and conditions and associated privacy policy of each such location- based service for information regarding how the third party provider of that service will use, disclose, protect and retain your location information. Such uses may include, but not be limited to, offering you location-based promotions and sharing your location with others. U.S. Cellular uses a variety of commercially reasonable and appropriate safeguards to protect location information residing on our systems from unauthorized access or disclosure including, without limitation, server firewalls and physical facility security. We also restrict access to location information to only those work groups that need to know that information for their job function. No security is perfect, however, and U.S. Cellular cannot guarantee the security of your location information. U.S. Cellular does not guaranty the accuracy or completeness of location information delivered through its network, and any location-based service may be disrupted or fail due to environmental factors and factors affecting satellite usage. You should understand the risks involved in consenting to the disclosure of your handset's location information before requesting a location based service and inform users to whom you provide your handset that his or her location can be tracked. Turning location \"OFF\" will hide the location of this handset from everyone except U.S. Cellular, the entities to which U.S. Cellular may disclose your location information as permitted by law, including but not limited to public safety, fire service or law enforcement officials in emergency situations, and third party providers of location-based services that track the location of this handset without U.S. Cellular's cooperation. "
You consent to disclosure of the location of this handset from U.S. Cellular to third-party providers of location-based services by turning location \"ON\"

"Introduction for Tethering
" Tethering allows your Android-powered device to be used as a modem to access the Internet on your laptop while on the go. This feature consumes battery power and increases your data usage. This service requires a subscription to the applicable modem plan. Please ensure you have subscribed to the appropriate data plan prior to use. Call 888-944-9400 if you need assistance. Use of service constitutes acceptance of the Smartphone Modem Terms.
Your device will alert you when your mobile data usage reaches the warning amount you set below

"Your mobile data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.
Since data usage is measured by your phone, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit."
Create an accessory related home screen when an accessory event has occurred
Context related pages will be created on the home screen

Page buddy will be created on the home screen when the following actions have been taken. For example, when the S Pen has been detached (only for models that include the S Pen), the earphones have been connected, and other specific actions
An icon that represents the page buddy will be added to the right side of the page indicator
The page buddy will appear automatically when you are on any of the Home screens
The page buddy will disappear automatically when you perform the opposite of the actions above
The page buddy includes handy shortcuts at the bottom of the screen to relevant apps that you use frequently
Recommended applications are listed from left to right in the order of frequency of use

"When this feature is enabled, you can see the photos that are in %1$s in the Gallery.
If you delete the photos from the Gallery, the photos in %2$s will also be deleted.
The photos will be removed when you disable this feature or delete your cloud service account"

"When this feature is enabled, you can see thumbnails and information for the videos that are in %1$s in the Video Player and Gallery.
If you delete the video thumbnails from the Video Player or Gallery, the videos in %2$s will also be deleted.
You need to be connected to mobile networks to play the videos. You can also download the videos to play them offline.
The video thumbnails will be removed when you disable this feature or delete your cloud service account"

"For Connection of 4G tethered mode, please plug in the cable first and then press the \"4G\" button to turn on. For Disconnection of 4G tethered mode, please turn off \"4G\" first and then plug off the cable. (Don't plug off the cable during using of tethered mode)"

Airplane mode allows you to turn off calling, messaging, and data network features. In addition, it turns off connectivity features such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. To use Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, please turn them on in the Settings or Notification panel
